jobs.title: Device Identification
jobs.body: Participant will be required to identify the features of a computer and record the name next to the correct letter.

software that is designed to covertly infiltrate or damage a computer system

questions.body: The _____ is an example of firmware.

choices.body: corrects the date and time setting when the CMOS battery is low
upgrades a P3 Intel processor to emulate an Intel P4 processor
increases the speed and functionality of Intel processors only

choices.body: a location allowing wired connections to a wireless network
a computer network covering a small physical area
public locations where wireless Internet access is available
a device for connecting multiple fiber optic Ethernet devices together to make them act as a single network segment

questions.body: The IP address 192.168.0.1 is an example of what type of address?

A customer calls and tells the computer technician their DSL Internet is running slow.  The customer has rebooted the computer and it's still slow as well as other computers through the wired and wireless connection within the house.  What is the <u>first</u>  step the technician should advise the customer to take?

choices.body: have the customer power cycle the DSL modem
have the customer try accessing the Internet through WIFI on their Smartphone
have the customer try accessing the Internet in Safe Mode on the PC
have the customer call the DSL company

questions.body: A system designed to prevent unauthorized access to or from a private network is known as a/an
A malicious program that presents itself as a legitimate program is a
Which of the following prevents, detects, and removes viruses, worms, and Trojans?

A technician has just finished adding more RAM to a customer's computer.  The RAM costs $85.23 and the technician took 1.5 hours to complete the upgrade.  Labor costs are $25.50 per hour.  The customer has a coupon for 15 percent off the cost of parts and labor.  The total bill before taxes would be
How should a computer handle an upset customer who called for technical support to ensure customer satisfaction and to maintain professionalism?

choices.body: The technician should listen to the customer until they have explained the situation, then calmly acknowledge their frustration, and let the customer know that he or she will do their very best to resolve the situation.
The technician should interrupt the customer and politely tell them to call back when they have calmed down.
The technician should place the customer on hold and wait a couple minutes for the customer to cool off.
The technician should place the customer on hold and transfer the call to their supervisor.

questions.body: When working with other technicians, why is it important to maintain thorough documentation?

choices.body: It ensures all technicians have access to the same information.
It is a government policy that companies have to adhere to.
It ensures a well-rounded job experience for all technicians.
It is a required part of every technician's job.

U.S. Environmental Protection Agency. (2013). Wastes- resource conservation- common wastes and materials – ecycling.

A technician has just finished adding more RAM to a customer's computer.  The RAM costs $85.23 and the technician took 1.5 hours to complete the upgrade.  Labor costs are $25.50 per hour.  The customer has a coupon for 15 percent off the cost of parts and labor.  The total bill before taxes would be
The <u>best</u> way to answer a store phone would be

choices.body: ''This is John.  How may I help you?''
''Howard's Jewelry, John speaking.  How may I help you?''

questions.body: A good way to develop additional business-related career skills is to

choices.body: work extra hard at your current job
develop a close relationship with the supervisors

questions.body: When developing a work plan that includes several jobs with various degrees of importance, which of the following should an employee do <u>first</u>?

choices.body: remove the least important job from the list
delegate several jobs to people in the department
arrange the jobs in order of priority
list the jobs in order of complexity

questions.body: When planning a week-long vacation, an employee should

choices.body: schedule the vacation six months in advance without clearing the dates with a supervisor
call in sick that week without prior notice
take off with no prior notice when several other employees will be absent at the same time
clear the vacation period with the supervisor to ensure sufficient staff during the absence

questions.body: When an employee is giving an oral presentation he or she should speak clearly and

Michael is applying for a management position in a department store.  During the interview Michael is asked to describe a time when he worked with others on a team.  Which of the following is the <u>best</u> way for Michael to respond?

choices.body: State that he worked successfully as a team member so often that no specific time stands out.
Give a story about a successful group project, how he contributed, and what the results were.
Give examples of all the teams he has worked on and say that all of them have been successful.
State that he enjoys working in a team, but also works well independently.

questions.body: The perpetual inventory system indicates that total inventory is $369,640 and the physical inventory totals $369,349.  Is there an overage or shortage, and how much?

Which of the following is an analogous color scheme?

choices.body: the percent and color of each fiber, name of manufacturer, and care requirements
names of dyes used, fabric finish, country of origin, and care requirements
color of yarns, names of dyes used, and fabric finish

questions.body: Which of the following is an example of highlighting the benefits of a product?

choices.body: ''This is the cheapest model we have, and it is also on sale today.''
''This will allow you to talk to both of your employees at the same time.''

questions.body: Putting a customer at ease is the _____ step in retail selling.
Which of the following is unethical behavior for a salesperson?

choices.body: telling a customer about available accessories for an item they wish to buy
selling merchandise at a discounted rate only on selected days
telling the customer about a store that carries a product that your store does not
telling a customer than an item is unavailable because you want to buy it

questions.body: A retail clerk received $50.00 from a customer to purchase goods valued at $32.16. What is the correct change to give the customer?

choices.body: 3 pennies, 1 nickel, 2 dimes, 2 quarters, and 1-$20 bill
4 pennies, 1 nickel, 3 quarters, 2-$1 bills, 1-$5 bill, and 1-$10 bill
1 nickel, 1 dime, 2 quarters, 2-$1 bills and 1-$10 bill

questions.body: The retailer paid $18.00 for a shirt and the markup for this item is 30 percent.  What is the retail price of this shirt?
Stock that is left in a storeroom or warehouse until moved onto the selling floor is known as _____ stock.
An order calls for 57 dresses.  One-third were backordered.  How many dresses were shipped?
Kevin has been asked by his manager to assemble an end-cap display, but is having a hard time because the props are too bulky and heavy.  What should Kevin do?

choices.body: replace the props with smaller materials
leave it unfinished for the manager to complete
finish the task alone, even if it takes him longer to do so
ask for assistance from a coworker

questions.body: A customer is trying to return a pair of jeans that were not sold at the store where Jessica is employed.  Jessica should <u>first</u>

choices.body: offer the customer a store credit for the jeans
offer a full return on the jeans
refer to the company return policy
reticket the jeans to sell them at the store

A primary purpose of a window display is to

choices.body: create interest and a desire to buy

choices.body: picture created in the mind of the customer
collection of styles that it sells

choices.body: present a single or small number of items
